00007 #define __MESSAGE_IMPL_H__

00009 #ifdef __cplusplus
00010 extern "C" {
00011 #endif

00014 #include "time.h"

00016 struct Connection;

00019 
00020 /// Message data structure.
00021 /// This structure abstracts and encapsulates the buffers used by the framework.
00022 /// The buffer management policies used by the framework deals with messages.
00023 /// Also, this class describes the format of the data exchanged over-the-wire
00024 /// between the server and its clients; this format includes a counter giving
00025 /// the size of the payload data, starting and ending flags, and other control
00026 /// fields that can be used by the applications. 
00027 /// Thread.
00028 struct Message /* packed, no alignment holes assumed */
00029 {
00030    // ------------------
00031 
00032    // identification of the connection that owns this Message, that is, the
00033    // Connection from which this message was received, or through which it will
00034    // be sent
00035 
00036    uint ipAddr; ///< @private The IP address of the Connection that owns this
00037                 /// Message
00038 
00039    // ------------------
00040    
00041    // identification of the Message
00042 
00043    ushort seqNo; ///< @private The sequence number of this Message.
00044                  /// Valid within the Connection that owns it (meaningful only
00045                  /// for a just received Message)
00046 
00047    time_t   creationTime; ///< @private The time when this Message was created.
00048                           /// Initialized by the client application (not being
00049                           /// used for anything at the moment)
00050 
00051    ushort flags; ///< @private Assorted flags describing the Message
00052 
00053    // --------- begin Message on the wire
00054 
00055    /// @private Marker in the start of a Message, used for consistency check.
00056    /// Position 0, length 1, value 0x7E
00057    char prefix;
00058 
00059    /// @private Unique serial number of this Message.
00060    /// Created by the originating client application.
00061    /// Position 1, length 4
00062    uint orgSeqNo;
00063 
00064    /// @private Identification of the originating client application.
00065    /// Position 5, length 4
00066    uint orgId;
00067 
00068    /// @private Number of seconds the Message should be considered valid.
00069    /// Initialized by the client application, could be used by a business rule.
00070    /// Position 9, length 4
00071    ushort duration;
00072 
00073    /// @private Size in bytes of actual data in the Message.
00074    /// Position 13, length 2
00075    ushort size; // in host order!
00076 
00077    /// @private Bytes of actual data in the message.
00078    /// Position 15, length <i> size </i>
00079    char body[];
00080 
00081    /// @private Marker in the end of a message, used for consistency check.
00082    /// Position 15+<i>size</i>, length 1, value '\x7E'.
00083    // char suffix;
00084 
00085    // --------- end Message on the wire
00086 };
00087 
00088 // the message is received in two parts:
00089 
00090 /// @private PART1: prefix (1), orgSeqNo (4), orgId (4), duration (2), size (2)
00091 /// @memberof Message
00092 #define MSG_SIZE_PART1    (1 + 4 + 4 + 2 + 2)
00093 
00094 /// @private PART2: body (size), suffix (1)
00095 /// @memberof Message
00096 #define MSG_SIZE_PART2(m) ((m)->size + 1)
00097 
00098 /// The boundary markers of a Message on the wire
00099 /// @private @memberof Message
00100 enum MessageMarkers
00101 {
00102    MSG_PREFIX = '\x7e',
00103    MSG_SUFFIX = '\x7e'
00104 };
00105

00107 #ifdef __cplusplus
00108 } // #ifdef __cplusplus
00109 #endif
00110 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00111 #endif // __MESSAGE_IMPL_H__
